banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: The microbes in our food can save lives
videoData.socialTitle: The microbes in our food can save lives

nodes.whoTheyAre: Dr. Robert Prill is a Computational Biologist at the IBM Almaden Research Center in California. He is an expert at combining genomic, phenotypic and metadata into integrative analyses evoking concepts from systems biology, machine learning, data science and visualization. Receiving a Ph.D. in Biomedical Engineering from the Johns Hopkins School of Medicine (2008), Prill currently leads an interdisciplinary team of engineers and scientists in pursuit of microbial biomarkers for food safety.

videoData.description: Does food talk? And if so, what is it saying? Microbe researcher Robert Prill decodes the messages sent by microorganisms to discover the telltale and potentially deadly signs of contaminated foods. Prill says that by paying closer attention we can save lives and better protect our food supply from adulteration.
videoData.socialDescription: Does food talk? And if so, what is it saying? Microbe researcher Robert Prill decodes the messages sent by microorganisms to discover the telltale and potentially deadly signs of contaminated foods. Prill says that by paying closer attention we can save lives and better protect our food supply from adulteration.
